sentences.english: His running is burning him up.
Big Sheep and Small Sheep were tired, hungry and thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 大羊和小绵羊疲倦，饥饿和干渴。

sentences.english: He did not reach out for a book.
sentences.chinese: 他没有取书读，疲倦得连睡意都感觉不到了。

sentences.english: At a time when I tired to stop dwelling poetically .
sentences.chinese: 在我疲倦的时候可以停下来诗意地栖居。

sentences.english: She worked tirelessly and had the knack of remembering everyone's name.
sentences.chinese: 她不知疲倦的工作，而且能够记住每个人的名字。

sentences.english: If tired, smell a whiff of clove oil and it will wake you up.
sentences.chinese: 如果疲倦，闻上一点丁香油将令人清醒。

sentences.english: Though he has walked a long way, he does not look a bit tired.
sentences.chinese: 他虽然走了那么长的路，但看上去一点儿不疲倦。

sentences.english: The life can be let I am here is weary unbearable.
sentences.chinese: 生活只能让我在此间疲倦不堪。

sentences.english: If you will go to bed so late, no wonder you're tired.
sentences.chinese: 如你偏要这么晚睡觉，自然就会感到疲倦。

sentences.english: Jap training methods are both humorless and tireless.
sentences.chinese: 日本人的训练方法即缺乏幽默感又不知疲倦。

sentences.english: The young waterbuck climbed up onto an island.
sentences.chinese: 他疲倦了，爬上了湖中的一个小岛。

sentences.english: Courageous, bold, almost to the point of ferocity, they were untiring and resistant to pain.
sentences.chinese: 勇敢，大胆，几乎到了凶猛点，他们不知疲倦和耐痛。

sentences.english: You'll grow ragged and weary and swarthy.
sentences.chinese: 你会变成皮肤粗糙，感到疲倦，皮肤黑黝。

sentences.english: He looks sleepy, maybe he stayed up late again yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 他看起来很疲倦，可能他昨天又开夜车了。

sentences.english: Tireless exporter of goods and importer of jobs?
sentences.chinese: 不知疲倦的产品出口国和就业进口国？

sentences.english: He dragged his tired feet slowly along.
sentences.chinese: 他拖着疲倦的步子慢慢地走着。

definition: dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
wan and sallow/thin and pallid/haggard/(of plants) withered
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
